Description: Shoulder sherd with turn of neck of pottery vase, perhaps dinos or krater; dull cream slip; interior: slipped at top of sherd (neck); exterior: band of tongues below junction of neck and shoulder; black-figure decoration consisting of perhaps a goat (rump, hind leg and torso remaining; added red on under belly) to left; rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.969)
